resources.string:
Springs are the best source of water in the woods, but are hard to come by and are not likely to actually be found. 
Running water is a good source of water because it is likely to have less sediment. 
Plant Roots are a good source of water. To prepare them: 
	•Dig or pry the roots out of the ground 
	•Cut the roots into short pieces 
	•Smash the pieces so the moisture runs out 
	•Catch the liquid in a container. 
☆IMPORTANT NOTE:	All water should be purified by brining it to a rolling boil and letting it boil for three minutes.

Snow and ice must be melted and brought to boiling for 3 minutes to purify \n☆IMPORTANT NOTE:\tDo not eat snow without melting first! This will bring down your body temperature and can lead to further dehydration. \nIf you are near the sea remember, the more crystalline and blue the ice is, the less salt it has.

Insects contain 65–80% protein, and are a great source of food. 
Avoid eating: 
	•Insects that bite or have stingers 
	•Insects that are hairy or bright colored 
	•Insects that have a pugnant odor 
	•spiders, ticks and mosquitoes as they carry diseases 
Cook insects with hard shells as they often carry parasites, and remove any wings and legs before eating. 
Worms are also a good source of protien. They can be found in damp humus soil. Worms put in clean potable water will purge themselves of toxins and dirt, and can be eatten raw. 
Fish are also a good sorce of food if they are available. Minnows can be eatten whole. 
☆Important Note:	The larger the mammal, the more damage it can do to you. Avoid hunting large mammals unless well armed or experienced.

If near water, fish can still be caught - although it may be ice fishing that is needed. 
Animals that can be hunted: 
	•Musk Ox 
		•Musk Ox are one of the largest arctic mammals and are peaceful but defend their young. 
	•Reindeer 
		•Reindeer have been domesticated by arctic human populations as a source of food, clothing, and shelter. 
	•Caribou 
		•Caribou have never been domesticated, but can make a good food source for a skilled hunter.

Polar Bears are capable of killing a seal with a single blow of its paw. 
Foxes: 
	•Arctic foxes often follow polar bears to feed off of what the bears leave behind. 
Wolves: 
	•Arctic wolves are usually found near caribou and can kill and adult caribou with one bite to the neck.
Snow is filled with pockets of air this means that building a shelter out of ice or snow will keep you warm, as it will be well insulated.
